alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Randolph (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 05 at 9:27AM CDT until April 05 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 AM CDT FOR MONROE...NORTHWESTERN RANDOLPH AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES... At 927 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Waterloo to near New Design to 7 miles north of Bloomsdale, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Freeburg, Red Bud and Smithton around 940 AM CDT. Belleville and Baldwin around 945 AM CDT. New Athens around 950 AM CDT. Marissa around 955 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Barr, Fayetteville, Renault, Lenzburg, Ames, Madonnaville, Prairie, Floraville, Hecker and Chalfin Bridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in St Louis.
